info.title: Transaction Search
info.description: Use the Transaction Search API to get the history of transactions for a PayPal account. To use the API on behalf of third parties, you must be part of the PayPal partner network. Reach out to your partner manager for the next steps. To enroll in the partner program, see Partner with PayPal. For more information about the API, see the Transaction Search API Integration Guide.

get.description:
Lists transactions. Specify one or more query parameters to filter the transaction that appear in the response.
Notes:
  • If you specify one or more optional query parameters, the ending_balance response field is empty.
  • It takes a maximum of three hours for executed transactions to appear in the list transactions call.
  • This call lists transaction for the previous three years.

200.description: A successful request returns the HTTP `200 OK` status code and a JSON response body that lists transactions .

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description:
Filters the transactions in the response by a PayPal transaction ID. A valid transaction ID is 17 characters long, except for an order ID, which is 19 characters long.
Note: A transaction ID is not unique in the reporting system. The response can list two transactions with the same ID. One transaction can be balance affecting while the other is non-balance affecting.

parameters.name: transaction_type
parameters.description: Filters the transactions in the response by a PayPal transaction event code. See [Transaction event codes](/docs/integration/direct/transaction-search/transaction-event-codes/).

parameters.name: transaction_status
parameters.description:
Filters the transactions in the response by a PayPal transaction status code. Value is:
Status codeDescription
DPayPal or merchant rules denied the transaction.
PThe transaction is pending. The transaction was created but waits for another payment process to complete, such as an ACH transaction, before the status changes to S.
SThe transaction successfully completed without a denial and after any pending statuses.
VA successful transaction was reversed and funds were refunded to the original sender.

parameters.name: transaction_amount
parameters.description:
Filters the transactions in the response by a gross transaction amount range. Specify the range as ` TO `, where `` is the lower limit of the gross PayPal transaction amount and `` is the upper limit of the gross transaction amount. Specify the amounts in lower denominations. For example, to search for transactions from $5.00 to $10.05, specify `[500 TO 1005]`.
Note:The values must be URL encoded.

parameters.name: transaction_currency
parameters.description: Filters the transactions in the response by a [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/api/reference/currency-codes/) for the PayPal transaction currency.

parameters.name: transaction_date
parameters.description:
Deprecated. Filters the transactions in the response by a PayPal transaction date, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6), with the from and to dates in ISO, URL-encoded format. For example: `[2012-12-15T17:55:29+0530 TO 2013-01-15T17:55:29+0530]`. The maximum supported range is 31 days. The maximum number of records in a single request is 10,000. If the account has more than 10,000 records for a specified date range, shorten the date range. The format of a date and time object is:
YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSOFFSET
The maximum length is 25 characters. For example:
2016-10-15T13:07:00+0000
Where:
  • YYYY. The year.
  • MM. The month.
  • DD. The date.
  • T. The actual character, T.
  • HH. The hour in 24-hour format.
  • MM. The minutes.
  • SS The seconds.
  • OFFSET. The five-character signed offset from GMT. For example, +0800.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Filters the transactions in the response by a start date and time, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). Seconds are required. Fractional seconds are optional.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Filters the transactions in the response by an end date and time, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). Seconds are required. Fractional seconds are optional. The maximum supported range is 31 days.

parameters.name: payment_instrument_type
parameters.description:
Filters the transactions in the response by a payment instrument type. Value is either:
  • CREDITCARD. Returns a direct credit card transaction with a corresponding value.
  • DEBITCARD. Returns a debit card transaction with a corresponding value.
If you omit this parameter, the API does not apply this filter.

parameters.name: store_id
parameters.description: Filters the transactions in the response by a store ID.

parameters.name: terminal_id
parameters.description: Filters the transactions in the response by a terminal ID.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Indicates which fields appear in the response. Value is a single field or a comma-separated list of fields. The transaction_info value returns only the transaction details in the response. To include all fields in the response, specify fields=all. Valid fields are:
  • transaction_info. The transaction information. Includes the ID of the PayPal account of the payee, the PayPal-generated transaction ID, the PayPal-generated base ID, the PayPal reference ID type, the transaction event code, the date and time when the transaction was initiated and was last updated, the transaction amounts including the PayPal fee, any discounts, insurance, the transaction status, and other information about the transaction.
  • payer_info. The payer information. Includes the PayPal customer account ID and the payer's email address, primary phone number, name, country code, address, and whether the payer is verified or unverified.
  • shipping_info. The shipping information. Includes the recipient's name, the shipping method for this order, the shipping address for this order, and the secondary address associated with this order.
  • auction_info. The auction information. Includes the name of the auction site, the auction site URL, the ID of the customer who makes the purchase in the auction, and the date and time when the auction closes.
  • cart_info. The cart information. Includes an array of item details, whether the item amount or the shipping amount already includes tax, and the ID of the invoice for PayPal-generated invoices.
  • incentive_info. An array of incentive detail objects. Each object includes the incentive, such as a special offer or coupon, the incentive amount, and the incentive program code that identifies a merchant loyalty or incentive program.
  • store_info. The store information. Includes the ID of the merchant store and the terminal ID for the checkout stand in the merchant store.

parameters.name: balance_affecting_records_only
parameters.description:
Indicates whether the response includes only balance-impacting transactions or all transactions. Value is either:
  • Y. The default. The response includes only balance transactions.
  • N. The response includes all transactions.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items to return in the response. So, the combination of `page=1` and `page_size=20` returns the first 20 items. The combination of `page=2` and `page_size=20` returns the next 20 items.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The zero-relative start index of the entire list of items that are returned in the response. So, the combination of `page=1` and `page_size=20` returns the first 20 items.

get.description:
List all balances. Specify date time to list balances for that time that appear in the response.
Notes:
  • It takes a maximum of three hours for balances to appear in the list balances call.
  • This call lists balances upto the previous three years.

200.description: A successful request returns the HTTP `200 OK` status code and a JSON response body that lists balances .

400.description: The request is not well-formed, is syntactically incorrect, or violates schema.

403.description: Authorization failed due to insufficient permissions.

parameters.name: as_of_time
parameters.description: List balances in the response at the date time provided, will return the last refreshed balance in the system when not provided.

parameters.name: currency_code
parameters.description: Filters the transactions in the response by a [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/api/reference/currency-codes/) for the PayPal transaction currency.

parameters.name: include_crypto_currencies
parameters.description:
Indicates whether the response list balances including crypto transactions. Value is either:
  • false. The default. The response doesn't include crypto transactions.
  • true. The response also includes crypto transactions.

get.description:
Lists partner transactions. Specify one or more query parameters to filter the transaction that appear in the response.
Notes:
  • It takes a maximum of six hours for executed transactions to appear in the list partner transactions call.

200.description: A successful request returns the HTTP `200 OK` status code and a JSON response body that lists transactions .

400.description: The request is not well-formed, is syntactically incorrect, or violates schema.

403.description: Authorization failed due to insufficient permissions.

parameters.name: integration_id
parameters.description: Filter the transactions in the response for integration id (BNCODE). Value is a single integration id or a comma-separated list of integration ids.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Filter the transactions in the response for Merchant payer ID.

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: Filters the transactions in the response by a start date and time, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). Seconds are required. Fractional seconds are optional. The maximum supported date range between start_time and end_time is 31 days.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: Filters the transactions in the response by an end date and time, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). Seconds are required. Fractional seconds are optional. The maximum supported date range between start_time and end_time is 31 days.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items to return in the response. So, the combination of `page=1` and `page_size=20` returns the first 20 items. The combination of `page=2` and `page_size=20` returns the next 20 items.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The zero-relative start index of the entire list of items that are returned in the response. So, the combination of `page=1` and `page_size=20` returns the first 20 items.

tags.name: transactions
tags.description: Use the `/transactions` resource to list transactions.

tags.name: partner-transactions
tags.description: Use the `/partner-transactions` resource to list transactions.

tags.name: balances
tags.description: Use the `/balances` resource to list balances.

transaction_details.description: An array of transaction detail objects.

start_date.description: The start date and time, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

end_date.description: The end date and time or the last date when the data can be served, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

last_refreshed_datetime.description: The date and time when the data was last refreshed, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

total_items.description: The total number of transactions as an integer beginning with the specified `page` in the full result and not just in this response.

total_pages.description: The total number of pages, as an `integer`, when the `total_items` is divided into pages of the specified `page_size`.

paypal_account_id.description: The ID of the PayPal account of the counterparty.

paypal_reference_id.description: The PayPal-generated base ID. PayPal exclusive. Cannot be altered. Defined as a related, pre-existing transaction or event.

paypal_reference_id_type.description:
The PayPal reference ID type. Value is:
  • ODR. An order ID.
  • TXN. A transaction ID.
  • SUB. A subscription ID.
  • PAP. A pre-approved payment ID.

transaction_event_code.description: A five-digit transaction event code that classifies the transaction type based on money movement and debit or credit. For example, T0001. See [Transaction event codes](/docs/integration/direct/transaction-search/transaction-event-codes/).

transaction_initiation_date.description: The date and time when work on a transaction began in the PayPal system, as expressed in the time zone of the account on this side of the payment. Specify the value in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

transaction_updated_date.description: The date and time when the transaction was last changed, as expressed in the time zone of the account on this side of the payment. Specify the value in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

transaction_amount.description: The all-inclusive gross transaction amount that was transferred between the sender and receiver through PayPal.

fee_amount.description:
The PayPal fee amount. All transaction fees are included in this amount, which is the record of fee associated with the transaction.
Note: This field contains a value only when a transaction fee is applied and processed for this transaction.

discount_amount.description:
The reduction in price offered for goods or services purchased.
Note: This discount is for a price reduction that is offered for other than that at a individual item level.

insurance_amount.description: An insurance charge. Guarantees the quality or delivery of a product.

sales_tax_amount.description: The PayPal- or merchant-reported sales tax amount for the transaction.

shipping_amount.description: The PayPal- or merchant-reported shipping amount for the transaction.

shipping_discount_amount.description: The discount on the shipping amount.

shipping_tax_amount.description: The tax on the shipping service.

other_amount.description: The special amount that is added to the transaction.

transaction_status.description:
A code that indicates the transaction status. Value is:
Status codeDescription
DPayPal or merchant rules denied the transaction.
PThe transaction is pending. The transaction was created but waits for another payment process to complete, such as an ACH transaction, before the status changes to S.
SThe transaction successfully completed without a denial and after any pending statuses.
VA successful transaction was fully reversed and funds were refunded to the original sender.

transaction_subject.description: The subject of payment. The payer passes this value to the payee. The payer controls this data through the interface through which he or she sends the data.

transaction_note.description: A special note that the payer passes to the payee. Might contain special customer requests, such as shipping instructions.

payment_tracking_id.description: The payment tracking ID, which is a unique ID that partners specify to either get information about a payment or request a refund.

bank_reference_id.description: The bank reference ID. The bank provides this value for an ACH transaction.

ending_balance.description:
The ending balance.
Note: If you specify one or more optional query parameters, the ending_balance response field is empty.

available_balance.description: The available amount of transaction currency during the completion of this transaction.

invoice_id.description:
The invoice ID that is sent by the merchant with the transaction.
Note: If an invoice ID was sent with the capture request, the value is reported. Otherwise, the invoice ID of the authorizing transaction is reported.

custom_field.description:
The merchant-provided custom text.
Note: Usually, this field includes the unique ID for payments made with MassPay type transaction.

protection_eligibility.description:
Indicates whether the transaction is eligible for protection. Value is:
  • 01. Eligible.
  • 02. Not eligible
  • 03. Partially eligible.

credit_term.description: The credit term. The time span covered by the installment payments as expressed in the term length plus the length time unit code.

credit_transactional_fee.description: The overall amount of the credit transaction fee.

credit_promotional_fee.description: The overall amount of the credit promotional fee.

annual_percentage_rate.description: The annual percentage rate (APR). Determines the amount of interest a consumer pays to finance a purchase at a merchant.

payment_method_type.description:
The payment method that was used for a transaction. Value is PUI, installment, or mEFT.
Note: Appears only for pay upon invoice (PUI), installment, and mEFT transactions. Merchants and partners in the EMEA region can use this attribute to note transactions that attract turn-over tax.

instrument_type.description: A high-level classification of the type of financial instrument that was used to fund a payment. The pattern is not provided because the value is defined by an external party.

instrument_sub_type.description: A finer-grained classification of the financial instrument that was used to fund a payment. For example, `Visa card` or a `Mastercard` for a credit card. The pattern is not provided because the value is defined by an external party.

common_components-v3-schema-json-openapi.title: Money
common_components-v3-schema-json-openapi.description: The currency and amount for a financial transaction, such as a balance or payment due.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

common_components-v3-schema-json-openapi.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.
The percentage, as a fixed-point, signed decimal number. For example, define a 19.99% interest rate as `19.99`.

email_address.description: The email address of the payer.

phone_number.description: The primary phone number of the payer.

address_status.description:
The address status of the payer. Value is either:
  • Y. Verified.
  • N. Not verified.

payer_status.description: The status of the payer. Value is `Y` or `N`.

country_code.description:
The [two-character ISO 3166-1 code](/docs/api/reference/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region of the payer.
Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.

common_components-v3-schema-json-openapi.description:
The internationalized email address.
Note: Up to 64 characters are allowed before and 255 characters are allowed after the @ sign. However, the generally accepted maximum length for an email address is 254 characters. The pattern verifies that an unquoted @ sign exists.

common_components-v3-schema-json-openapi.title: Phone
common_components-v3-schema-json-openapi.description: The phone number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en).

country_code.description: The country calling code (CC), in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the CC and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

national_number.description: The national number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the country calling code (CC) and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

prefix.description: The prefix, or title, to the party's name.

given_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's given, or first, name.

surname.description: When the party is a person, the party's surname or family name. Also known as the last name. Required when the party is a person. Use also to store multiple surnames including the matronymic, or mother's, surname.

middle_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's middle name. Use also to store multiple middle names including the patronymic, or father's, middle name.

suffix.description: The suffix for the party's name.

alternate_full_name.description: DEPRECATED. The party's alternate name. Can be a business name, nickname, or any other name that cannot be split into first, last name. Required when the party is a business.

full_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's full name.

common_components-v3-schema-json-openapi.description:
The [two-character ISO 3166-1 code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.
Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.

common_components-v3-schema-json-openapi.title: Simple Postal Address (Coarse-Grained)
common_components-v3-schema-json-openapi.description: A simple postal address with coarse-grained fields. Do not use for an international address. Use for backward compatibility only. Does not contain phone.

line1.description: The first line of the address. For example, number or street.

line2.description: The second line of the address. For example, suite or apartment number.

state.description: The [code](/docs/api/reference/state-codes/) for a US state or the equivalent for other countries. Required for transactions if the address is in one of these countries: [Argentina](/docs/api/reference/state-codes/#argentina), [Brazil](/docs/api/reference/state-codes/#brazil), [Canada](/docs/api/reference/state-codes/#canada), [China](/docs/api/reference/state-codes/#china), [India](/docs/api/reference/state-codes/#india), [Italy](/docs/api/reference/state-codes/#italy), [Japan](/docs/api/reference/state-codes/#japan), [Mexico](/docs/api/reference/state-codes/#mexico), [Thailand](/docs/api/reference/state-codes/#thailand), or [United States](/docs/api/reference/state-codes/#usa). Maximum length is 40 single-byte characters.

postal_code.description: The postal code, which is the zip code or equivalent. Typically required for countries with a postal code or an equivalent. See [postal code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_code).

method.description: The shipping method that is associated with this order.

address.description: The shipping address that is associated with this order.

secondary_shipping_address.description: The secondary shipping address that is associated with this order.

tax_inclusive.description: Indicates whether the item amount or the shipping amount already includes tax.

paypal_invoice_id.description: The ID of the invoice. Appears for only PayPal-generated invoices.

item_code.description: An item code that identifies a merchant's goods or service.

item_options.description: The item options. Describes option choices on the purchase of the item in some detail.

item_quantity.description: The number of purchased units of goods or a service.

item_unit_price.description: The cost for each instance of goods or a service.

item_amount.description: The amount of the payment for the item.

discount_amount.description: The reduction in price associated with goods or a service.

adjustment_amount.description: An increment or decrement to a purchase amount.

gift_wrap_amount.description: The amount of money charged for gift wrapping an item.

tax_percentage.description: A rate, expressed in hundreds, that is used to calculate a levy for the purchase of goods or services.

tax_amounts.description: An array of tax amounts levied by a government on the purchase of goods or services.

items.description: A tax levied by a government on the purchase of goods or services.

extra_shipping_amount.description: The cost for expedited delivery of the goods.

handling_amount.description: A charge for processing the purchase of goods or services.

insurance_amount.description: A charge for guaranteeing the quality of a product or delivery of a product.

total_item_amount.description: The sum of all factors, item cost, discounts, tax, shipping, and so on, that goes into the cost of an item.

invoice_number.description: The invoice number. An alphanumeric string that identifies a billing for a merchant.

checkout_options.description: An array of checkout options. Each option has a name and value.

items.description: A checkout option as a name-and-value pair.

item_detail_tax_amount.json.title: Tax Amount
item_detail_tax_amount.json.description: The tax levied by a government on the purchase of goods or services.

tax_amount.description: The tax levied by a government on the purchase of goods or services.

checkout_option.json.title: Checkout Option
checkout_option.json.description: A checkout option as a name-and-value pair.

checkout_option_name.description: The checkout option name, such as `color` or `texture`.

checkout_option_value.description: The checkout option value. For example, the checkout option `color` might be `blue` or `red` while the checkout option `texture` might be `smooth` or `rippled`.

store_id.description: The ID of a store for a merchant in the system of record.

terminal_id.description: The terminal ID for the checkout stand in a merchant store.

auction_site.description: The name of the auction site.

auction_buyer_id.description: The ID of the buyer who makes the purchase in the auction. This ID might be different from the payer ID provided for the payment.

auction_closing_date.description: The date and time when the auction closes, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

incentive_type.description: The type of incentive, such as a special offer or coupon.

incentive_code.description: The code that identifies an incentive, such as a coupon.

incentive_program_code.description: The incentive program code that identifies a merchant loyalty or incentive program.

href.description: The complete target URL. To make the related call, combine the method with this [URI Template-formatted](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570) link. For pre-processing, include the `$`, `(`, and `)` characters. The `href` is the key HATEOAS component that links a completed call with a subsequent call.

rel.description: The [link relation type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5988#section-4), which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link. See [Link Relations](https://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml).

method.description: The HTTP method required to make the related call.

mediaType.description: The media type, as defined by [RFC 2046](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2046.txt). Describes the link target.

encType.description: The media type in which to submit the request data.

schema.description: The schema that describes the request data.

targetSchema.description: The schema that describes the link target.

common_components-v3-schema-json-openapi.title: Link Schema
common_components-v3-schema-json-openapi.description: The request data or link target.

allOf.description: An array of sub-schemas. The data must validate against all sub-schemas.

items.title: All Of Item
items.description: A sub-schema against which the data must validate.

anyOf.description: An array of sub-schemas. The data must validate against one or more sub-schemas.

items.title: Any Of Item
items.description: A sub-schema against which the data must validate.

oneOf.description: An array of sub-schemas. The data must validate against one sub-schema.

items.title: One Of Item
items.description: A sub-schema against which the data must validate.

media.title: Media
media.description: The media type and context-encoding scheme.

type.description: The media type. See [Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) Part Two: Media Types](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2046).

binaryEncoding.description: The content-encoding scheme. See [Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) Part One: Format of Internet Message Bodies](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2045).

pathStart.description: To apply this schema to the instances' URIs, start the URIs with this value.

total_items.description: The total number of transactions. Valid only for `RESULTSET_TOO_LARGE`.

maximum_items.description: The maximum number of transactions. Valid only for `RESULTSET_TOO_LARGE`.

name.description: The human-readable, unique name of the error.

message.description: The message that describes the error.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

details.description: An array of additional details about the error.

common_components-v3-schema-json-openapi.title: Error Details
common_components-v3-schema-json-openapi.description: The error details. Required for client-side `4XX` errors.

field.description: The field that caused the error. If this field is in the body, set this value to the field's JSON pointer value. Required for client-side errors.

value.description: The value of the field that caused the error.

location.description: The location of the field that caused the error. Value is `body`, `path`, or `query`.

issue.description: The unique, fine-grained application-level error code.

description.description: The human-readable description for an issue. The description can change over the lifetime of an API, so clients must not depend on this value.

balances.description: An array of balance detail objects.

crypto_balances.description: An array of Cryptocurrency balance detail objects. Cryptocurrency balance represents the state and cryptocurrency asset values of a PayPal customer account.

as_of_time.description: The requested date and time or the last date and time when the balances can be served, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

last_refresh_time.description: The date and time when the balances was last refreshed, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

currency.description: Currency Code of the balances listed.

primary.description: Optional field representing if the currency is primary currency or not.

total_balance.description: The total amount in PayPal account. It is the sum of all the other balances.

available_balance.description: The amount of cash in an Account which is at the customer's disposal. This amount is captured at settlement cutoff time in the user's time zone as defined for the user.

withheld_balance.description: Balance withheld in the account. The portion of funds that PayPal holds for the customer that is not currently at the customer's disposal.

payable_balance.description: An amount of money that PayPal owes to the customer (due to accumulated payments).

receivable_balance.description: An amount of money the customer owes to PayPal (due to various types of loans).

common_components-v4-schema-json-openapi.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

common_components-v4-schema-json-openapi.title: Money
common_components-v4-schema-json-openapi.description: The currency and amount for a financial transaction, such as a balance or payment due.

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

common_components-v4-schema-json-openapi.title: Cryptocurrency
common_components-v4-schema-json-openapi.description: Representation of a specific amount of Cryptocurrency, denoted by its symbol and quantity.
The Cryptocurrency ticker symbol / code as assigned by liquidity providers (exchanges).

Quantity of a cryptocurrency asset.
This is a decimal number with scale defined for each Cryptocurrency by the founders. For example,
  • Bitcoin(BTC) has 8 as scale,
  • Ethereum (ETH) has 18 as scale.

    • PayPal Cryptocurrency platform handles the scale to 8 digits for Bitcoin and its forks or offshoots and Ehereum.

The PayPal payer ID, which is a masked version of the PayPal account number intended for use with third parties. The account number is reversibly encrypted and a proprietary variant of Base32 is used to encode the result.

The date and time, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). Seconds are required while fractional seconds are optional.
Note: The regular expression provides guidance but does not reject all invalid dates.

name.description: The human-readable, unique name of the error.

message.description: The message that describes the error.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

details.description: An array of additional details about the error.

common_components-v4-schema-json-openapi.title: Error Details
common_components-v4-schema-json-openapi.description: The error details. Required for client-side `4XX` errors.

field.description: The field that caused the error. If this field is in the body, set this value to the field's JSON pointer value. Required for client-side errors.

value.description: The value of the field that caused the error.

location.description: The location of the field that caused the error. Value is `body`, `path`, or `query`.

issue.description: The unique, fine-grained application-level error code.

description.description: The human-readable description for an issue. The description can change over the lifetime of an API, so clients must not depend on this value.

href.description: The complete target URL. To make the related call, combine the method with this [URI Template-formatted](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570) link. For pre-processing, include the `$`, `(`, and `)` characters. The `href` is the key HATEOAS component that links a completed call with a subsequent call.

rel.description: The [link relation type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5988#section-4), which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link. See [Link Relations](https://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml).

method.description: The HTTP method required to make the related call.

mediaType.description: The media type, as defined by [RFC 2046](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2046.txt). Describes the link target.

encType.description: The media type in which to submit the request data.

schema.description: The schema that describes the request data.

targetSchema.description: The schema that describes the link target.

common_components-v4-schema-json-openapi.title: Link Schema
common_components-v4-schema-json-openapi.description: The request data or link target.

allOf.description: An array of sub-schemas. The data must validate against all sub-schemas.

items.title: All Of Item
items.description: A sub-schema against which the data must validate.

anyOf.description: An array of sub-schemas. The data must validate against one or more sub-schemas.

items.title: Any Of Item
items.description: A sub-schema against which the data must validate.

oneOf.description: An array of sub-schemas. The data must validate against one sub-schema.

items.title: One Of Item
items.description: A sub-schema against which the data must validate.

media.title: Media
media.description: The media type and context-encoding scheme.

type.description: The media type. See [Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) Part Two: Media Types](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2046).

binaryEncoding.description: The content-encoding scheme. See [Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) Part One: Format of Internet Message Bodies](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2045).

pathStart.description: To apply this schema to the instances' URIs, start the URIs with this value.

transaction_details.description: An array of transaction detail objects.

start_time.description: The start date and time, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

end_time.description: The end date and time or the last date when the data can be served, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

last_refresh_time.description: The date and time when the data was last refreshed, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

total_items.description: The total number of transactions as an integer beginning with the specified `page` in the full result and not just in this response.

total_pages.description: The total number of pages, as an `integer`, when the `total_items` is divided into pages of the specified `page_size`.

counterparty_account_id.description: The ID of the PayPal account of the counterparty.

account_id.description: The ID of the PayPal account of the subject/merchant.

reference_id.description: The PayPal-generated base ID. PayPal exclusive. Cannot be altered. Defined as a related, pre-existing transaction or event.

reference_id_type.description:
The PayPal reference ID type. Value is:
  • ODR. An order ID.
  • TXN.

initiation_time.description: The date and time when work on a transaction began in the PayPal system, as expressed in the UTC time zone. Specify the value in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

payment_instrument_type.description: A high-level classification of the type of financial instrument that was used to fund a payment. E.g. PAYPAL, CREDIT_CARD, DEBIT_CARD, APPLE_PAY, BANK , VENMO or Alternative Payment Methods (APM).

payment_instrument_sub_type.description: A finer-grained classification of the financial instrument that was used to fund a payment. For example, VISA or MASTER_CARD for a credit card.

payout_instrument_type.description: A high-level classification of the type of financial instrument that was used for Payout. E.g. `BANK`.

payout_instrument_sub_type.description: A finer-grained classification of the financial instrument that was used for Payout.

checkout_channel.description: Indicates if the payment happened through online or offline channel.

x-enum.description: Payment made using PayPal Here device.

delayed_disbursement.description: Indicates whether the transcation is delayed disbursement or not. Values are `true` or `false`.

amount.description: The all-inclusive gross transaction amount that was transferred between the sender and receiver through PayPal.

seller_amount.description: The amount moved in or out of the merchant PayPal account.

credit_transaction.description: Indicates if money has been credited to the account. Values are `true` or empty.

debit_transaction.description: Indicates if money has been debited from the account. Values are `true` or empty.

pending_disbursement_amount.description: The amount which is pending for disbursement to Merchant PayPal account.

hold_amount.description: The amount which is kept on hold during disputes

fees.description: An array of transaction fee objects.

status.description: A code that indicates the transaction status.

x-enum.description: The transaction is pending. The transaction was created but waits for another payment process to complete, such as an ACH transaction, before the status changes to S
The transaction successfully completed without a denial and after any pending statuses.

invoice_id.description: The invoice ID that is sent by the partner with the transaction.

payable_amount.description: The amount moving in and out of the partner's Payable GL account. Funds moving out of the payable account have a dash (-).

payable_account_id.description: The currency of the Payable Amount.

store_id.description: The ID of a store for a merchant in the system of record. This property supports Unicode.

decline_code.description: Indicates reason of decline. This property supports Unicode.

payout_reference_id.description: Indicates Transaction id or any unique value for a Payout transaction by receiver of the amount. This property supports Unicode.

x-enum.description: Auth type transactions for Auth or Auth void.
Chargeback type transactions for Chargeback fee or Chargeback fee reversal.
Fees type transactions for Partner Fee, Payment Fee or Fee Reversal.
Recoup type transactions done either from Bank or Loss Accounts
Void subtype transactions, applicable for transaction type Auth.
Fee subtype transactions, applicable for transaction type Chargeback.
Reversal subtype transactions, applicable for transaction types Chargeback, Fees and Withdrawal.
Partner fee subtype transactions, applicable for transaction type Fees.
Payment fee subtype transactions, applicable for transaction type Fees.
Masspay subtype transactions, applicable for transaction type Payment.
Bank subtype transactions, applicable for transaction type Withdrawal.
Loss account subtype transactions, applicable for transaction type Recoup.
To subtype transactions, applicable for transaction type Currency conversion
From subtype transactions, applicable for transaction type Currency conversion
Refund subtype transactions, applicable for transaction type Fees.

common_components-v4-schema-json-openapi.description: The time zone, in [Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) time zone (tz) database format](https://www.iana.org/time-zones). A valid value is `America/New_York` or `Etc/UTC`. Do not use ambiguous, non-qualified tz database values, such as `EST` or `GB`. Before you include this type in your interface, consider whether it is appropriate to convey time zone information with your type. At the time of display to the user, transform this value from UTC. Typically, this type is associated with user-preference APIs.

type.description: Type of the Fee. E.g. `PARTNER` or `PAYPAL` or `CHARGEBACK`.

account_id.description: The ID of the PayPal account this fee went in or moved out.

amount.description: The fee amount for the given type.

x-errors.name: BAD_REQUEST
x-errors.description: The request is not well-formed or is syntactically incorrect or violates the schema.

x-errors.name: INTERNAL_SERVICE_ERROR
x-errors.description: Something unexpected occurred on the server.

x-errors.name: INVALID_RESOURCE_ID
x-errors.description: The requested resource could not be found but may be available in the future. Subsequent requests by the client are permissible.

x-errors.name: RESULTSET_TOO_LARGE
x-errors.message: Result set size is greater than the maximum limit. Change the filter criteria and try again.
x-errors.description: The request returned more items than the maximum limit. To reduce the result set, include additional query parameters.
